channel.title: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD)
channel.description: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD) generated by script

item.title: UN General Assembly Demands That Russia Return Ukrainian Children Amid the War
item.description: The United States voted in favor with 90 other countries (many European), while Russia and 11 others voted against the resolution, which was non-binding. China and 56 countries, mostly from Africa and Asia, abstained, although South Africa voted yes for the first time on an Assembly resolution favoring Ukraine. “This is a real victory for ... Read more

item.title: Where do the USAID legal battles stand?
item.description: Ten months after USAID fell apart, many of the most consequential cases challenging Trump’s foreign aid agenda are still unfolding.

item.title: How UK aid cuts are hammering education in Sierra Leone
item.description: The country is losing nearly half its FCDO funding, which NGOs say will have a devastating effect on education programs.

item.title: Devex Dish: In Nepal, nutrition gains begin to unravel without USAID
item.description: The future of Food for Peace, and plant treaty talks fail to reach a compromise.

item.title: Devex Newswire: How US aid cuts have hit the ballot box
item.description: The termination of USAID governance programs in Uganda has narrowed the country's civic space, and the halting of USAID-backed nutrition system in Nepal threatens to unravel gains in malnutrition elimination. Plus, the CEO of The END Fund dives into their funding model.

item.title: Syria: Hope emerges amid ongoing human rights challenges
item.description: For the first time in the country’s history, Syrians are preparing to publicly mark Human Rights Day next week — a small but meaningful step that UN human rights officials say signals a “new chapter” in their engagement with the authorities, and a cautiously optimistic moment for millions seeking change.

item.title: Crackdown on Palestinian civil society is reaching alarming levels, warns UN human rights office
item.description: The UN human rights office, OHCHR, has condemned an Israeli raid on the Union of Agricultural Work Committees in the occupied West Bank, warning that pressure on Palestinian civil society has reached alarming levels.

item.title: General Assembly LIVE: Emergency session to vote on resolution demanding return of Ukrainian children from Russia
item.description: The UN General Assembly’s emergency special session spotlighting Russian aggression against Ukraine has reconvened in New York where the world body will vote on a resolution demanding Moscow end the forcible transfer and separation from their families, of Ukrainian children, as the war grinds on. Follow live coverage below and go here for detailed coverage of other key meetings. UN News app users can follow the vote here.

item.title: Genuine inclusion of persons with disabilities is a win for us all: Guterres
item.description: Discussions around promoting greater inclusion of people with disabilities in society topped the agenda at the United Nations on Wednesday.

item.title: UN sounds alarm as landmine deaths rise amid funding cuts
item.description: The deadly legacy of conflicts old and new – from Gaza to Sudan and beyond – continues to kill and maim civilians on a near-daily basis, mine action workers said on Wednesday, as they appealed for greater support for their lifesaving work in the face of deep funding cuts.

item.title: Myanmar: Opium crop hits 10-year high amid conflict and economic collapse
item.description: Opium poppy cultivation in Myanmar has surged to a ten-year high, the United Nations reported on Wednesday, underscoring how prolonged conflict and economic collapse are driving farmers deeper into the illicit economy.

item.title: World News in Brief: Food insecurity triples, Mozambique aid boost, Uganda elections alert
item.description: The number of people facing acute food insecurity has tripled since 2016 to nearly 300 million, even as food-sector funding has fallen back to 2016 levels, the Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO) said on Wednesday, launching its first-ever Global Emergency and Resilience Appeal:

item.title: General Assembly demands return of Ukrainian children by Russia
item.description: The UN General Assembly on Wednesday demanded by a wide margin that Russia immediately and unconditionally return all Ukrainian children who have been forcibly transferred or deported since the start of the war.

item.title: Air strikes and shelling continue in Gaza
item.description: The UN has called for an investigation into the recent “horrific” killing by Israeli forces of two young brothers in Gaza who were reportedly targeted by a drone while collecting firewood.

item.title: Sudan’s crisis deepens with communities trapped in ‘siege conditions’
item.description: Civilians across Sudan’s Kordofan region are facing extreme hardship as conflict intensifies, warned the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) on Wednesday.

item.title: Invest in diagnostics to win the health fight
item.description: Opinion: The world's fight against NCDs is costing lives and straining budgets without access to medical imaging and testing. Three steps can improve access to cost-effective diagnostics, delivering early intervention and system resilience.

item.title: Career paths for UN peacekeepers
item.description: As approximately 17,000 U.N. peacekeepers face job losses due to budget cuts, Devex asks the experts for advice on their next steps.

item.title: Why the UN Environment Assembly is Essential to a Safer, More Resilient Planet
item.description: Inger Andersen is Executive Director of the United Nations Environment Programme

item.title: The US is breaking a lifesaving global food aid system
item.description: Opinion: Moving Food for Peace, a key humanitarian program that has survived cuts to U.S. aid so far, to the U.S. Department of Agriculture would be a grave mistake.

item.title: The End Fund: A collaborative fund approach to health integration
item.description: In the wake of mass foreign aid cuts, the global health sector can learn lessons from The End Fund’s private sector, collaborative approach.

item.title: A decade of nutrition gains at risk as US-funded systems vanish in Nepal
item.description: The USAID-backed nutrition system that once reached some of Nepal’s most vulnerable districts has collapsed, halting screening and straining health posts already short on staff and supplies.
